capstone.element

Class MysteryBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • capstone.element.Element
      • capstone.element.MysteryBox

  • public class MysteryBox
extends Element
    A MysteryBox is a kind of element, that, when collided with, reveals an Event that can be interpreted by the Level class to perform some sort of action or event, such as create a new Element (e.g. key) or injure a Player.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MysteryBox.Event
      The types of Events that a mystery-box can reveal.

    • Method Detail

      • showMessage

        public static void showMessage(com.googlecode.lanterna.gui.GUIScreen gui,
                               java.lang.String message)
        Shows a MessageBox on the given screen with the given message, and gives the MessageBox the title "MysteryMessage".
        Parameters:
        gui - The GUIScreen to display the MessageBox on.
        message - The message to display.

      • reveal

        public MysteryBox.Event reveal(com.googlecode.lanterna.gui.GUIScreen gui,
                               Region relativeTo)
        Reveals the MysteryBox's event and displays its message on the GUIScreen passed, then unrenders itself from the screen.
        Parameters:
        gui - The GUIScreen to display the MessageBox on and where to unrender the MysteryBox from.
        relativeTo - The relative Region of the MysteryBox, for unrendering.
        Returns:
        The Event contained by the MysteryBox.

      • event

        public MysteryBox.Event event()
        The MessageBox must be revealed first before you can acces its event.
        Returns:
        The Event of the MysteryBox.

      • isRevealed

        public boolean isRevealed()
        Returns:
        True if the MyseryBox has been revealed yet, else false.
